title: Fix deployment error and successfully deploy the app live

requirements.text: Identify the root cause of the previous live deployment failure (“Deployment error”) by reproducing the production deployment locally (or in the CI/deploy environment) and capturing the exact failing step and error output, then apply the minimal code/config changes needed so the same deployment completes successfully.
acceptanceCriteria: A deployment run that previously failed now completes without errors using the same production/live deployment command/process.
The specific root cause is documented in the PR/commit description (what failed, why, and what changed to fix it).

requirements.text: After the deployment succeeds, perform a post-deploy smoke test of the live site to confirm it is accessible and functional (homepage loads, header/footer render, and the Contact section external links are present).
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the live URL loads the marketing page without a blank screen or console-fatal errors.
Header and footer are visible, and the Contact section includes links for email, X/Twitter, and Instagram.
No missing critical static asset requests are observed for above-the-fold content (e.g., logo/hero image requests do not 404).

constraints: Backend must remain single-actor with all Motoko logic in backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo if existing stable state must be upgraded.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose them instead).
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Adding new product features unrelated to resolving the deployment failure.
Changing authentication providers (must remain Internet Identity).
Introducing external databases or non-Motoko backend services.
